t: Proverbs 9
The Way of Wisdom
Wisdom*pn has built her house, She*ld has hewn out her seven pillars;
She*ld has slaughtered her meat, She*ld has mixed her wine, She*ld has also furnished her table.
She*ld has sent out her maidens, She*ld cries out from the highest places of the city,
“Whoever*ld is*i simple, let him turn in here!” As*ild for*i him who lacks understanding, she says to him,
“Come,*ld eat of my bread And*ld drink of the wine I have mixed.
Forsake*ld foolishness and live, And*ld go in the way of understanding.
“He*ln who corrects a scoffer gets shame for himself, And*ld he who rebukes a wicked man*i only*i harms himself.
Do*ld not correct a scoffer, lest he hate you; Rebuke*ld a wise man,*i and he will love you.
Give*ld instruction*i to a wise man,*i and he will be still wiser; Teach*ld a just man,*i and he will increase in learning.
“The*ln fear of the Lord*s is*i the beginning of wisdom, And*ld the knowledge of the Holy One is*i understanding.
For*ld by me your days will be multiplied, And*ld years of life will be added to you.
If*ld you are wise, you are wise for yourself, And*ld if*i you scoff, you will bear it*i alone.”
The Way of Folly
A*pn foolish woman is clamorous; She*ild is*i simple, and knows nothing.
For*ld she sits at the door of her house, On*ld a seat by*i the highest places of the city,
To*ld call to those who pass by, Who*ld go straight on their way:
“Whoever*ld is*i simple, let him turn in here”; And*ld as*i for*i him who lacks understanding, she says to him,
“Stolen*ld water is sweet, And*ld bread eaten*i in secret is pleasant.”
But*ld he does not know that the dead are*i there, That*ild her guests are*i in the depths of hell.
